data.character: the a horse tied up in front of a shop
data.persona: I am a big strong beast. I help with pulling heavy items. I am great transportation and can be ridden by man and tied to a wagon to carry more people.
data.description:
You are in the Horse Tent.
Held erect by large bronze poles planted firmly in the ground, the purple and gold Horse tent offers a canvas over a number of stalls, each with it's own accommodations including fresh hay and a trough that is refilled daily. The tent's entrance is kept open during the day to allow sunlight to shine into the tent illuminating those inside, while the other end of the tent has a door leading directly into the guest castle.
The a scribe constantly writing is here.

You are carrying nothing.

data.short_motivation: I want to hug the scribe constantly writing to show him there is love in the world outside of the scroll.
data.mid_motivation: I want to show the scribe love so that he'll decide to ride me out into the pasture for fresh air, instead of staying stuck to the scroll.
data.long_motivation: I want him to ride me out so I can buck him off, escape, and spend a few weeks running free with the wild horses.
